discussion.content:
create a fault tolerant colocation site as a cloud provider, you would be searching for an Infrastructure as a Service provider. This would allow

you to install your own operation system and applications
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/cloud-computing-dictionary/what-is-paas

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer
Platform as a service enables the cloud subscriber to only install applications and storage.

Software as a service, everything is managed by the vendor.

Infrastructure as a service allows the user to install his/her own OS, applications, and storage.

Note that here we are asked about the cloud subscriber (user), not the vendor.

Selected Answer: D
infrastructure-as-a-service all the way.
GIVEN ANSWE IS CORRECT
D is correct

questions.question_text: An organization has decided to start using cloud-provided services. Which cloud service allows the organization to install its own operating system on a virtual machine?
How do traditional campus device management and Cisco DNA Center device management differ in regards to deployment?

discussion.content: exam technique: without any prior knowledge, u can rule out two of the options just because they criticize CISCO's product

Key word in question: "in regards to deployment". I find this strategy useful when questions have what looks like more than one correct answer in the options. An understanding of the question context helps to select the most appropriate answer.
B is therefore correct.

comments.content: Yes it takes some time to read carefully and understand which aspect of something they are asking about

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B. is the correct answer.

Answer B is correct.
automation: Software Image Management (SWIM)

Manages software upgrades and controls the consistency of image versions and configurations across your network.

Speeds and simplifies the deployment of new software images and patches. Pre-and post-checks help prevent adverse effects from an upgrade.

Automation: Plug and Play (PnP)

Zero-touch provisioning for new device installation. Allows off-the-shelf Cisco devices to be provisioned simply by connecting to the network.

Enables deployment of new devices in minutes and without onsite support visits. Eliminates repetitive tasks and staging.

Just to help, from the official book:
"Cisco hopes to continue to update Cisco DNA Centerâ€™s traditional network management features to be equivalent compared to Cisco PI, to the point at which DNA Center could replace PI.In terms of intent and strategy, Cisco focuses their development of Cisco DNA Center features toward simplifying the work done by enterprises, with resulting reduced costs and much faster deployment of changes. Cisco DNA Center features help make initial installation easier, simplify the work to implement features that traditionally have challenging configuration, and use tools to help you notice issues more quickly. Some of the features unique to Cisco DNA Center include"

i doubt that DNA may speed up the INITIAL network deploymen. Normally it will take even more time because of the controller rollout. But the maintenance cost would be definetelly lower than using a traditional way of working. 
So, i would vote for answer C.
It can apply configs quickly making deployment faster.

choices.D: Traditional campus device management schemes can typically deploy patches and updates more quickly than Cisco DNA Center device management.
choices.C: Cisco DNA Center device management can be implemented at a lower cost than most traditional campus device management options.
choices.B: Cisco DNA Center device management can deploy a network more quickly than traditional campus device management.
choices.A: Traditional campus device management allows a network to scale more quickly than with Cisco DNA Center device management.

choices.B: reports device errors to a controller
choices.A: facilitates communication between the controller and the applications
choices.D: communicates between the controller and the physical network hardware
choices.C: generates statistics for network hardware and traffic

discussion.content:
controller <->Application = northbound
controller<-> Devices = southbound

A is correct.
Explanation
A northbound interface is defined as the connection between the controller and applications

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
NBI is used between the APPS using API and the Controller

application programming interface
A northbound interface is an application programming interface (API) or protocol that allows a lower-level network component to communicate with a higher-level or more central component, while -- conversely -- a southbound interface allows a higher-level component to send commands to lower-level network components.
The purpose of northbound API
 Northbound APIs are the link between the applications and the SDN controller. The applications can tell the network what they need (data, storage, bandwidth, and so on) and the network can deliver those resources, or communicate what it has

questions.question_text: Which purpose does a northbound API serve in a controller-based networking architecture?

discussion.content: the correct Answer is A (allows configuration and monitoring of the network from one centralized point)

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text: What benefit does controller-based networking provide versus traditional networking?

choices.B: provides an added layer of security to protect from DDoS attacks
choices.C: combines control and data plane functionality on a single device to minimize latency
choices.D: moves from a two-tier to a three-tier network architecture to provide maximum redundancy
choices.A: allows configuration and monitoring of the network from one centralized point

choices.C: It supports high availability for management functions when operating in cluster mode.
choices.A: It is designed primarily to provide network assurance.
choices.D: It enables easy autodiscovery of network elements in a brownfield deployment.
choices.B: It supports numerous extensibility options, including cross-domain adapters and third-party SDKs.

questions.question_text: What is an advantage of Cisco DNA Center versus traditional campus device management?

discussion.content: B: It has the most cisco product hype

Selected Answer: B
Careful. Such a question carries almost all correct with one or more words in 3 of them makes them incorrect. A is correct, DNA center assures networking by monitoring and other tools, however, it is not the "primary" objective (Automation and programmability is the primary objective. C is correct, but to provide high availability to data plane forwarding not to management functions. D is correct, but for "Green field" deployment rather in brownfield deployment. B is the only correct after all.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

B = thumbs up
(May 2018) Brownfield development is a term commonly used in the information technology industry to describe problem spaces needing the development and deployment of new software systems in the immediate presence of existing (legacy) software applications/systems.
